library.name: Brahan Engine SOP Library
library.description: Standard Operating Procedures for well intervention operations. Each SOP defines the operational sequence, required equipment, hazards, and decision points.

procedures.title: Gas Lift Valve Change-Out
procedures.description: Procedure for pulling and replacing gas lift valves in side pocket mandrels using slickline kickover tool.

prerequisites.description: GLV pocket depth confirmed from completion records

barriers.notes: SCSSV must remain functional throughout operation. If SCSSV fails function test, STOP and implement well kill procedure.

steps.action: Confirm well is shut-in and pressures stabilized
steps.verification: THP and CHP stable for minimum 30 minutes

steps.action: Rig up lubricator and pressure test to MAASP + 10%
steps.verification: Pressure held for 10 minutes with no bleed-off

steps.action: Function test SCSSV
steps.verification: SCSSV closes on command, THP builds confirming seal

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 4
STOP. Implement SOP_015 (SCSSV Failure Response)

steps.action: Make up pulling toolstring: Rope Socket → Stem → Knuckle Joint → Kickover Tool → GLV Pulling Tool
steps.verification: All connections torqued to spec, tool string measured and recorded

steps.action: RIH at controlled speed (60 ft/min max), correlate depths using tubing collar log
steps.verification: Collar count matches expected, weight indicator shows smooth descent

steps.action: Locate GLV pocket - feel for mandrel profile, confirm depth
steps.verification: Depth matches completion schematic, kickover engages pocket

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 7
POOH, run drift/gauge first (SOP_008)
POOH, review completion schematic, consider memory gauge run

steps.action: Kick over into pocket, engage GLV latch, apply steady upward pull
steps.verification: Weight indicator shows release, string free

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 8
Apply jar, max 3 attempts. If unsuccessful, POOH and evaluate
POOH, prepare fishing string (SOP_020)

steps.action: POOH with pulled GLV at controlled speed
steps.verification: GLV recovered to surface, inspected for damage

steps.action: Make up running toolstring with new GLV
steps.verification: GLV serial number recorded, test rack pressure confirmed

steps.action: RIH to target pocket, locate and kick over
steps.verification: Depth confirmed, kickover engaged

steps.action: Push GLV into pocket until latch engages, apply set-down weight to confirm
steps.verification: Weight indicator shows release, string pulls free

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 12
Pull back, re-attempt max 3 times. If fails, POOH with GLV, inspect pocket (may need gauge ring run)

steps.action: POOH with running tool
steps.verification: String recovered, running tool intact

steps.action: Rig down lubricator, restore well to production
steps.verification: Well flowing, THP/CHP stable, GLV functioning per design

nptRisks.mitigation: Pre-job review of GLV history, have fishing tools on standby
Review completion schematic, run CCL if required

procedures.title: Bridge Plug Setting
procedures.description: Procedure for running and setting a retrievable or permanent bridge plug for zone isolation.

restrictions: Confirm no restrictions below setting depth

prerequisites.description: Drift run completed to confirm clear bore to setting depth + 100ft
Setting depth confirmed from completion schematic

barriers.notes: Bridge plug will become a barrier element once set and tested

steps.action: Confirm well status, review completion schematic, confirm setting depth
steps.verification: Setting depth signed off by operations and engineering

steps.action: Rig up lubricator and pressure test
steps.verification: Pressure test passed

steps.action: Run gauge ring/drift to setting depth + 100ft to confirm clear bore
steps.verification: Drift reaches target depth, POOH clean

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 4
STOP. Run LIB to identify obstruction. May require fishing or cleanout.

steps.action: Make up bridge plug on setting tool with appropriate slickline string
steps.verification: Assembly checked by two personnel, setting mechanism confirmed safe

steps.action: RIH to setting depth at controlled speed, correlate using collar log
steps.verification: Depth confirmed by collar count

steps.action: Confirm exact depth, apply setting force per manufacturer specs
steps.verification: Weight indicator shows plug has set, string releases

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 7
Pull back 50ft, re-run, attempt set again. Max 3 attempts.
Apply jar per procedure. If stuck, initiate fishing contingency.

steps.action: POOH with setting tool, rig up pressure test assembly
steps.verification: Setting tool recovered intact

steps.action: Pressure test plug from above to confirm seal
steps.verification: Plug holds test pressure for required duration

decisionOptions.action: Operation complete. Document and proceed to next activity.
Retrieve plug (SOP_003), inspect, re-run or replace

nptRisks.mitigation: Verify plug condition pre-job, have backup plug
Use quality plugs, confirm setting depth is in good casing

procedures.title: Bridge Plug Retrieval
procedures.description: Procedure for retrieving a retrievable bridge plug. NOTE: This procedure was revised following the Well_666 incident.

prerequisites.description: Pressure above and below plug equalized where possible
Pulling tool and jar certified and inspected

barriers.notes: WARNING: Be aware of barrier status once plug is retrieved. Ensure secondary barriers in place.

steps.action: Review original setting report - confirm plug type, depth, any anomalies during setting
steps.verification: Setting report reviewed, plug details confirmed
steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: Always review historical data before attempting retrieval

steps.action: Rig up lubricator with sufficient length for plug + toolstring
steps.verification: Lubricator pressure tested, length sufficient

steps.action: Equalize pressure across plug if possible
steps.verification: Pressure readings confirm equalization or document differential

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 4
Document differential, ensure pulling tool rated for load, consider staged retrieval

steps.action: Make up pulling toolstring with SHEAR RELEASE above overshot
steps.verification: Shear release confirmed in string, shear value documented
steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: ALWAYS include shear release to prevent uncontrolled forces on completion

steps.action: RIH to plug depth, tag top of plug gently
steps.verification: Plug tagged at expected depth

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 6

decisionOptions.condition: Tag shallow - possible debris on plug
decisionOptions.action: STOP. POOH and run LIB to inspect (Step 5a)

decisionOptions.condition: No tag at depth - plug may have moved
decisionOptions.action: Continue deeper cautiously, reassess

steps.action: Run Lead Impression Block (LIB) to inspect plug top
steps.verification: LIB recovered, impression analyzed BY QUALIFIED PERSONNEL

decisionOptions.condition: Clean impression of plug fishing neck
decisionOptions.action: Continue retrieval attempt

decisionOptions.condition: Debris or FOD visible in impression
decisionOptions.action: STOP. Clean out debris before retrieval (junk basket, magnet)
Send impression to shore for expert analysis before proceeding

steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: The LIB showed the tong die but was not recognized. ALWAYS have impressions reviewed by experienced personnel. When in doubt, send to shore.

steps.action: Engage overshot onto plug fishing neck, confirm latch
steps.verification: Overpull confirms latch engagement

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 7
Release, reposition, re-attempt. Max 3 attempts before running LIB.
STOP. Run LIB (Step 5a). DO NOT apply excessive force.

steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: Multiple failed latch attempts without diagnostics led to catastrophic outcome

steps.action: Apply steady upward pull to release plug from seat. Use jar if required - CONTROLLED strokes only.
steps.verification: Weight indicator shows release, string free to move

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 8
Continue to Step 8, document jarring force used
STOP. Do NOT continue jarring. Shear release if necessary. Run diagnostics. Consult engineering.

steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: Excessive jarring caused casing deformation and barrier damage. NEVER exceed 5 jar strokes without engineering review.

steps.action: POOH slowly with plug. Monitor for hang-ups, especially at SCSSV and tubing hanger.
steps.verification: Plug clears all restrictions, recovered to surface

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 9
Work carefully. If stuck, do NOT force. May need to set back and run smaller retrieval tool.
CRITICAL: Stop immediately. Assess risk of SCSSV damage. Consult engineering before proceeding.

steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: Expanded element snagged SCSSV protection sleeve, causing catastrophic barrier damage

steps.action: Recover plug to surface, inspect for damage, debris, or anomalies. Rig down.
steps.verification: Plug complete and intact. If any parts missing, initiate fishing operation.

decisionOptions.action: Operation complete. Document condition.
STOP. Initiate SOP_020 (Fishing Operations). Do NOT proceed with other activities until FOD cleared.

nptRisks.risk: Plug stuck and cannot be retrieved
nptRisks.mitigation: Have fishing contingency ready, engineering support on call

nptRisks.risk: FOD on top of plug prevents latching
nptRisks.mitigation: Run LIB before attempting latch if any doubt

nptRisks.risk: Plug element damages completion during POOH
nptRisks.mitigation: Know all restrictions, POOH slowly, stop at first sign of resistance

procedures.revisionNotes: Rev 2.0 incorporates all lessons from Well_666 incident. Key changes: mandatory shear release, mandatory LIB after 3 failed latch attempts, jarring limit of 5 strokes, enhanced POOH monitoring at SCSSV.

procedures.title: Drift/Gauge Run
procedures.description: Procedure for running drift or gauge ring to confirm minimum bore and identify any restrictions.

prerequisites.description: Drift size selected based on completion schematic min ID

steps.action: Rig up lubricator, pressure test
steps.verification: Pressure test passed

steps.action: Make up drift toolstring, RIH to target depth at controlled speed
steps.verification: Drift reaches target depth

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 3
Record depth of restriction, POOH, run LIB to identify

steps.action: POOH, inspect drift for damage/marks
steps.verification: Drift recovered, condition documented

procedures.title: SCSSV Function Test
procedures.description: Procedure for testing Surface Controlled Subsurface Safety Valve function and integrity.

barriers.notes: SCSSV is the barrier being tested

steps.action: Shut in well, allow pressures to stabilize
steps.verification: THP/CHP stable

steps.action: Bleed control line pressure to close SCSSV
steps.verification: Control line pressure at zero, THP begins to rise (confirms closure)

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 3
FAILURE. Implement contingency - well kill or insert valve may be required.

steps.action: Monitor THP for leak-off through closed SCSSV
steps.verification: THP holds or increases (no leak)

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 4
Document leak rate. If exceeds criteria, SCSSV requires repair/replacement.

steps.action: Apply control line pressure to re-open SCSSV
steps.verification: Control line pressure at operating value, THP/CHP equalize

decisionOptions.action: Test complete. Document results.
CRITICAL FAILURE. Well cannot be produced. Wireline intervention required to lock open or replace.

steps.criticalNote: Well_666 SCSSV was found stuck closed in 2021, likely due to debris or damage from 2016 event

nptRisks.mitigation: Regular testing, prompt response to any anomalies

procedures.title: Slickline Fishing Operations
procedures.description: Procedure for recovering lost or stuck equipment from the wellbore using slickline fishing tools. Based on lessons from Well_666.

restrictions: Fish must be within slickline capability

prerequisites.description: LIB run to confirm fish top and condition
Fishing tools selected based on fish dimensions
Time and cost contingency approved by management

barriers.notes: Extended fishing operations require regular barrier verification

steps.action: Review all available data on fish - how it got there, dimensions, orientation
steps.verification: Fishing plan documented and approved
steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: Thorough assessment before fishing prevents extended NPT

steps.action: Run LIB to confirm fish top depth, orientation, and any debris
steps.verification: Clear impression obtained, analyzed by experienced personnel

decisionOptions.action: Continue to Step 3
Run additional LIBs at different approaches. Send to shore for expert analysis if needed.
Clean out debris first (junk basket, magnet) before fishing attempt

steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: Always analyze LIB carefully. The tong die was visible but not recognized.

steps.action: Select appropriate fishing tool based on fish type and LIB results
steps.verification: Tool selection approved by fishing specialist
steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: Simple tools (junk basket) were more effective than complex tools in debris recovery

steps.action: Make up fishing string with SHEAR RELEASE, RIH to fish
steps.verification: Tools reach fish depth

steps.action: Engage fish, apply controlled pull. If jar required, limit strokes.
steps.verification: Fish engaged and moving, or string released safely

decisionOptions.action: POOH carefully, continue to Step 6
POOH, run LIB, reassess approach
Limited jarring (max 5 strokes). If no movement, shear release and reassess.

steps.action: POOH with fish, inspect at surface
steps.verification: Fish recovered complete

decisionOptions.action: Document, assess if further fishing required
Return to Step 2, continue fishing until bore clear
Run LIB to locate, restart fishing sequence

nptRisks.mitigation: Expert involvement, clear decision points, management escalation triggers
Use shear release, controlled jarring, proper tool selection
Force limits, engineering oversight, stop work authority

procedures.revisionNotes: Incorporates all lessons from Well_666 fishing operation

procedures.title: Lead Impression Block (LIB) Run
procedures.description: Procedure for running Lead Impression Block to obtain impression of downhole obstructions or equipment. Critical diagnostic tool - revised based on Well_666 lessons.

prerequisites.description: Experienced analyst available for impression interpretation

steps.action: Select LIB size, prepare fresh lead face, document pre-run condition
steps.verification: LIB photographed before run

steps.action: RIH to target, tag obstruction gently to obtain impression
steps.verification: LIB contacts target at expected depth

steps.action: POOH, recover LIB to surface
steps.verification: LIB recovered intact

steps.action: Photograph impression from multiple angles. Analyze with experienced personnel.
steps.verification: Impression analyzed and documented

decisionOptions.action: Plan next steps based on identification
Consider additional LIB run at different angle/approach
DO NOT DISMISS. Send photos to shore for expert analysis. Review all possibilities including FOD.

steps.criticalNote: LESSON FROM WELL_666: The LIB showed a tong die impression but was dismissed as 'unclear' by on-site crew. This single miss led to catastrophic failure. WHEN IN DOUBT, SEND TO SHORE FOR EXPERT ANALYSIS.

nptRisks.mitigation: Run multiple LIBs if first unclear

procedures.revisionNotes: Rev 2.0 adds mandatory expert analysis requirement for any unclear impressions. Direct result of Well_666 incident.
